headline.main: Daily Activity Tied to Lower Alzheimer's Risk
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs: Regimens: Physical Activity and Alzheimer’s Risk

docs.abstract: Higher levels of daily physical activity in the elderly were associated with a decreased risk of Alzheimer's disease in a new study.
docs.snippet: Higher levels of daily physical activity in the elderly were associated with a decreased risk of Alzheimer's disease in a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Brennan is leaving as the big British pharmaceutical company struggles with generic competition and lower revenue and profits.

headline.print_headline: As AstraZeneca Profit Falls, Its Chief Is Stepping Down

docs.abstract: AstraZeneca chief executive David Brennan is stepping down as the company struggles with competition from makers of generic drugs and the failure of several development projects; chief financial officer Simon Lowth will become interim chief while the board conducts a search for a successor; company reports that its revenue for the first quarter fell 11 percent to $7.35 billion, and earnings per share plunged 38 percent.
docs.snippet: David Brennan is leaving as the big British pharmaceutical company struggles with generic competition and lower revenue and profits.

docs.abstract: Research on obesity and food availability in poor areas suggests that access must be considered alongside factors like price, taste and education, too.
docs.snippet: Research on obesity and food availability in poor areas suggests that access must be considered alongside factors like price, taste and education, too.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study in Las Vegas has found that boxers’ brains may show physical changes in areas that deal with functions like memory and alertness before they exhibit any cognitive declines.

headline.seo: Study Shows Changes in Fighters’ Brains Before Symptoms
headline.main: Study of Fighters Shows Brain Changes Are Seen Before Symptoms
headline.print_headline: Study of Fighters Shows Brain Changes Are Seen Before Symptoms

docs.abstract: Study at the Cleveland Clinic in Las Vegas finds that boxers’ brains may show physical changes in areas that deal with functions like memory and alertness before they exhibit any cognitive declines; doctors who study athletes' brain injuries say research has focused too narrowly on concussions and hard blows to the head rather than more constant lesser blows.
docs.snippet: A study in Las Vegas has found that boxers’ brains may show physical changes in areas that deal with functions like memory and alertness before they exhibit any cognitive declines.

docs.lead_paragraph: For a small group of researchers and their patients facing death, psychedelic drugs aren’t a hippie palliative. They’re a new way to approach the most dire time of life.

headline.main: How Psychedelic Drugs Can Help Patients Face Death
headline.print_headline: A Kaleidoscope at the End of the Tunnel

docs.abstract: Lauren Slater article on researchers across the country who are investigating the healing power of psychedelic drugs, like LSD and psilocybin, for fear and anxiety in terminal patients.
docs.snippet: For a small group of researchers and their patients facing death, psychedelic drugs aren’t a hippie palliative. They’re a new way to approach the most dire time of life.
